q_en: Have all of John's orders been completed?
gt:
Sure! Let's take a look at John's orders and see if they've all been completed. Here's a summary of the order products and their completion status:

| Order Product ID | Total Number of Products | Total Completed |
|------------------|--------------------------|-----------------|
| 6                | 95                       | 95              |
| 7                | 110                      | 110             |
| 8                | 50                       | 50              |
| 9                | 80                       | 80              |
| 10               | 100                      | 100             |
| 32               | 150                      | 0               |

It looks like all of John's orders have been completed except for the order product with ID 32, which hasn't been completed yet. Almost there, John! üòÑ

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'John';
steps.description: Retrieve the customer ID for the customer with the name "John"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE user_id = '2';
steps.description: Retrieve all order IDs for the customer with the retrieved customer ID

steps.sql: SELECT id, number FROM order_product WHERE order_id IN (2, 10);
steps.description: Retrieve the order_product IDs and the total number of products for each order

steps.sql: SELECT order_product_id, SUM(completed_number) AS total_completed FROM sewing_tasks WHERE order_product_id IN (6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 32) GROUP BY order_product_id;
steps.description: Retrieve the total completed number of sewing tasks for each order_product
